snippet: After a court let new limits take effect, many clinics prepared to shut down, leaving those seeking their services distraught.
abstract: Many clinics across Texas say they have stopped providing abortions and are preparing to shut down, one day after federal appeals court cleared the way for state’s restrictive abortion law to take effect.

byline.original: By LAURA TILLMAN and JOHN SCHWARTZ
byline.contributor: Laura Tillman reported from McAllen, and John Schwartz from New York.

lead_paragraph: After a court let new limits take effect, many clinics prepared to shut down, leaving those seeking their services distraught.

headline.main: Texas Clinics Stop Abortions After Court Ruling
headline.print_headline: Texas Abortion Clinics Say Court’s Ruling Is Forcing Them to Stop the Procedures
